issue.title: Error 500 Internal Server Error in /admin/api-admin-menu

repository.name: luya
repository.description: LUYA is a scalable web framework and content management system with the goal to please developers, clients and users alike.

issue.body: ### What steps will reproduce the problem? ``` $ composer create-project luyadev/luya-kickstarter:@dev $ cd luya-kickstarter $ cd configs $ cp env.php.dist env.php $ cp env-local-db.php.dist env-local-db.php $ vi env-local-db.php (configure DB connection for a PostgreSQL database) $ cd .. $ ./vendor/bin/luya migrate $ ./vendor/bin/luya import $ ./vendor/bin/luya setup ``` - Configure `/etc/hosts` and Apache virtualhost `luya.local`. - Go to http://luya.local/admin and enter admin user credentials. ### What is the expected result? The admin page rendered without errors. ### What do you get instead? (A Screenshot can help us a lot!) A 500 (Internal Server Error) message. ![2016-12-20-221323_1280x1024_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616169/21368234/fd43a4be-c701-11e6-9117-a4bd8c157319.png) If I go to http://luya.local/admin/api-admin-menu, I get the following XML output: ``` Unauthorized Your request was made with invalid credentials. 0 401 yii\web\UnauthorizedHttpException ``` ### LUYA Check ouput (run this script and post the result: [luyacheck.php](https://gist.github.com/nadar/022f890e064c068e75ce6178cd14a09e)) ``` 1: [in_array('mod_rewrite', apache_get_modules())] true 2: [ini_get('short_open_tag')] '' 3: [ini_get('error_reporting')] '22527' 4: [phpversion()] '7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3' 5: [php_ini_loaded_file()] '/etc/php/7.0/apache2/php.ini' 6: [php_sapi_name()] 'apache2handler' ``` | Q | A | ---------------- | --- | LUYA Version | e2f7db7 | PHP Version | 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3 | Platform | Apache | Operating system | Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

body: Query support is a good idea though.

But its not possible to use the query builders [max()](http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/yii-db-query.html#max()-detail) method (or any other aggregation methods) as it will directly return the response value and its not possible to access the rawSql.

issue.title: Fix #13278: `DbQueryDependency` created

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | no
| New feature?  | yes
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #13278

Fixes #13278 adding new `DbQueryDependency` cache dependency
